intro: Sagraea pusilliflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sagraea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slight pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
